places.title: Calle de la Cava Baja
places.description: A narrow street in the city center, famous for its traditional Madrid taverns. They serve the famous 'cocido madrile√±o' (national stew soup) and excellent Spanish wines.

places.title: Gran Via
places.description: Madrid's main shopping and entertainment street, famous for its theaters, cinemas and nightlife. It is the Spanish equivalent of Broadway, where you can find fashionable boutiques, panoramic terraces and luxury hotels.

places.title: Temple of Debod
places.description: This Egyptian temple was given to Spain by the Egyptian government and brought to Madrid stone by stone. It is located in a picturesque park, and in the evening it is beautifully illuminated, creating a romantic atmosphere.

places.title: Almudena Cathedral
places.description: The main cathedral of Madrid, built in an unusual combination of neo-Gothic and Art Nouveau. Inside you can see a luxurious altar, stained glass windows and a crypt with Roman catacombs.

places.title: Descalzas Reales Monastery
places.description: A former monastery of Spanish infantas and aristocrats. Inside there are magnificent frescoes, antique furniture and a unique collection of paintings by Renaissance masters.
